WarrensGame package¶

Submodules¶

WarrensGame.AI module¶

class WarrensGame.AI.AI(character)¶

Bases: object

Base class for AI logic Methods are empty, to be implemented by subclasses

property character¶

Returns character to which this AI is linked.

takeTurn()¶

Take one turn

class WarrensGame.AI.BasicMonsterAI(monster)¶

Bases: WarrensGame.AI.AI

AI sub class that provides AI implementation for basic monsters.

takeTurn()¶

Take one turn

class WarrensGame.AI.ConfusedMonsterAI(sourceEffect, confusedMonster, confusedTurns)¶

Bases: WarrensGame.AI.AI

AI sub class that provides AI implementation for confused monsters. It can be used to confuse a monster for a number of turns. After the turns the confusedAI will switch the monster back to the original AI.

randomDirection()¶

Select a random direction away from the current location. Returns None if no suitable direction is found. :return: None or a tuple (x,y) direction

takeTurn()¶

Take one turn

WarrensGame.Actors module¶

class WarrensGame.Actors.Actor¶

Bases: object

Base class for everything that can occur in the gameworld. Example sub classes: Items and Characters.

property actionTaken¶

Property to indicate if the actor took an action. Used by Game class to keep track of turns. :return: Boolean

property char¶

Returns a 1 char shorthand for this actor.

property color¶

This actors preferred color (RGB tuple).

property currentHitPoints¶

The current amount of hitpoints

property flavorText¶

Fancy description of the monster.

property inView¶

This actor is in view of the player.

property json¶

Json dictionary representation of the Actor. This will contain the data elements that are needed for the game client to function. :return: Json dictionary object

property key¶

ID code for this Actor

property level¶

Returns level on which this Actor is located. Can be None.

property maxHitPoints¶
moveAlongVector(vx, vy)¶

moves this actor on the current map according to the specified vector

moveToLevel(targetLevel, targetTile)¶

moves this actor to the targetTile on the targetLevel

moveToRandomTile()¶

moves this actor to a random tile on the current level

moveToTile(targetTile)¶

moves this actor to the targetTile on the current level

moveTowards(targetActor)¶

Moves this actor towards the provided actor. arguments

actor - the target Actor object

property name¶

Name of this Actor

registerWithLevel(level)¶

This function registers this actor with the provided level. It has to be overridden in the Actor subclasses to ensure that the actor correctly registers with the level.

removeFromLevel()¶

This method removes this actor from the level

property sprite_id¶

Property to store the sprite ID for this Actor. This can be used by the GUI to visualize the Actor.

takeDamage(amount, attacker)¶

base function to take damage from an attacker. arguments

damage - the incoming damage attacker - the attacking Actor

property tile¶

Returns the Tile on which this Actor is located. Can be None.

class WarrensGame.Actors.Character¶

Bases: WarrensGame.Actors.Actor

Base class for characters that can move around and interact Should probably not be instantiated but describes the general interface of a character Basic logic is in here, more specialised logic will be in the subclasses Every character has an AI that governs it Every character manages an inventory of items

ACTIVE = 0¶
property AI¶

Return AI associated to this character.

DEAD = 1¶
property accuracy¶
addItem(item)¶

adding item puts it in this characters inventory

property armor¶
attack(target)¶

Attack another Character Arguments

target - the Character to be attacked

property baseAccuracy¶
property baseArmor¶
property baseBody¶
property baseDamage¶
property baseDodge¶
property baseMind¶
property body¶
property damage¶
property dodge¶
dropItem(item)¶

Make this character drop an item on the current tile. Arguments

item - the item to be dropped

equipItem(item)¶

basic implementation of equiping, doesn’t take into account equipment slots. Should be overridden in subclass implementations.

property equipedItems¶

Returns a list of items that this characters has equiped. These are the equiped items only.

property equipmentBonusAccuracy¶
property equipmentBonusArmor¶
property equipmentBonusBody¶
property equipmentBonusDamage¶
property equipmentBonusDodge¶
property equipmentBonusMind¶
property inventory¶
property mind¶
pickUpItem(item)¶

Make this character pick up an item. Arguments

item - the item to be picked up

registerWithLevel(level)¶

Makes the level aware that this character is on it.

removeItem(item)¶

removes the item from the characters inventory

property state¶

Returns this characters state

takeDamage(amount, attacker)¶

function to take damage from an attacker arguments

damage - the incoming damage attacker - the attacking Actor

takeHeal(amount, healer)¶

function to heal a given amount of hitpoints arguments

amount - the number of hitpoints to heal healer - the source of teh healing

takeTurn()¶

Function to make this Character take one turn.

unEquipItem(item)¶

basic implementation of equiping, doesn’t take into account equipment slots. Should be overridden in subclass implementations.

property xpValue¶

Return xp value

class WarrensGame.Actors.Consumable(baseItem)¶

Bases: WarrensGame.Actors.Item

Sub class for items that can be used and consumed.

applyTo(target)¶

Applies the effect of this consumable to a target. The target can be several types of object, it depends on the specific Effect subclass.

property effect¶

The effect that this consumable can generate.

property effectDuration¶

The duration of the effect that this consumable can generate.

property effectElement¶

The element of the effect that this consumable can generate.

property effectHitDie¶

The HitDie of the effect that this consumable can generate.

property effectRadius¶

The radius of the effect that this consumable can generate.

property isConsumed¶

Boolean indicating if this stack of consumable has been consumed completely

property targeted¶

Boolean that indicates whether this consumable is targeted.

class WarrensGame.Actors.Player¶

Bases: WarrensGame.Actors.Character

Sub class representing a player

property direction¶

Last direction in which this player moved :return: (x,y) modifier that shows the direction

followPortal(portal)¶

Send player through specified portal.

gainXp(amount)¶

Increase xp of this player with the given amount arguments

amount - integer

levelUp()¶

Increase level of this player

property nextLevelXp¶

Returns the required Xp to reach the next player level

property playerLevel¶

Returns the current level of the player.

tryDropItem(item)¶

Player attempts to drop an item. This function is meant to be called from the GUI.

tryFollowPortalDown()¶

Player attempts to follow a portal down at the current location. This function is meant to be called from the GUI.

tryFollowPortalUp()¶

Player attempts to follow a portal up at the current location. This function is meant to be called from the GUI.

tryInteract()¶

Player attempts to interact with actors on the current tile. This function is meant to be called from the GUI. If the interaction requires further handling in the GUI and interaction object will be returned. Returns None if the interaction can be completed without further GUI activities.

tryMoveOrAttack(dx, dy)¶

Player tries to move or attack in direction (dx, dy). This function is meant to be called from the GUI. This function will also register that the player took an action

tryUseItem(item, target=None)¶

Player attempts to use an item. This function is meant to be called from the GUI.

property xp¶

Returns the current xp of the player.

This class can be used to represent portals in and out of a level

connectTo(otherPortal)¶

Connects this portal to another portal

property destinationPortal¶

The destination portal where this portal leads to

property message¶

In game message that should be displayed when portal is used.

registerWithLevel(level)¶

Makes the level aware that this portal is on it.

WarrensGame.Database module¶

Created on Apr 14, 2014

@author: pi

This file contains some testing code to access a sqlite database. It should not be used. Currently there are no plans to store the game data in sqlite.

WarrensGame.Effects module¶

class WarrensGame.Effects.ConfuseEffect(source)¶

Bases: WarrensGame.Effects.MagicEffect

This class represents a damage nova effect

applyTo(target)¶

Confuse effect will be applied to target monster. :target: Monster object :return: None

tick()¶

Apply a tick of the confuse effect :return: None

class WarrensGame.Effects.DamageEffect(source)¶

Bases: WarrensGame.Effects.MagicEffect

This class implements a damage effect. It can be targeted, in which case it will damage all actors in a circular area. It can be untargeted, in which case it will function as a nova, damaging all actors in a circular area around the source, excluding the tile of the source

applyTo(target)¶

Damage area is circular around center. If this effect is targeted, the center will be the given target. If this effect is not targeted, the center will be the source of the effect. All actors on the tiles in the area of effect will be damaged. :target: Actor or Tile Object :return: None

property centerTile¶

Returns tile on which the damage area is centered.

tick()¶

Apply one tick of damage :return: None

class WarrensGame.Effects.Effect(source)¶

Bases: object

Base class for more specialized events, melee or magic effects.

property actors¶

The actors affected by this effect. :return: List of actors

applyTo(target)¶

Applies this effect to a target. The target can be several types of objects, it depends on the specific Effect subclass.

property effectDescription¶

Textual description that describes what happens when this effect is applied.

property effectDuration¶

Duration of this effect in number of turns.

property effectElement¶

The element of this effect.

property effectHitDie¶

Hit die used to determine the random size of this effect.

property effectRadius¶

Radius of the effect size

property sceneObject¶

Property used to store the scene object that represents this actor in the GUI. :return: SceneObject

property source¶

The source of this effect

property targetType¶

indicates the type of target this effect needs, enumerator

property targeted¶

Boolean that indicates whether this effect is targeted.

tick()¶

Applies an additional duration tick for this effect. Supposed to be overridden in subclass.

property tiles¶

The tiles affected by this effect. :return: List of tiles

WarrensGame.Game module¶

Created on Apr 13, 2014

To understand the design, it is recommended to read the class design documentation on the wiki first!

@author: pi

class WarrensGame.Game.Game¶

Bases: object

The game class contains the logic to run the game. It knows about turns It has pointers to all the other stuff, via the Game object you can drill down to all components It can save and load It keeps track of the levels and knows which is the current level

FINISHED = 1¶
PLAYING = 0¶
property activeEffects¶

A list of the currently active effects :return: Array of Effects

addCaveLevel(difficulty, connectedLevels)¶

Adds a cave level to this game. Connect the new cave level to the connectedLevels :param difficulty: Difficulty for the new cave level :param connectedLevels: Levels to which the new cave level will be connected :rtype : None

addDungeonLevel(difficulty, connectedLevels)¶

Adds a dungeon level to this game. Connect the new dungeon level to the connectedLevels :param difficulty: Difficulty for the new dungeon level :param connectedLevels: Levels to which the new dungeon level will be connected :rtype : None

broadcast_game_state()¶
property currentLevel¶

Returns the current level

getPossibleTargets(seeker)¶

Returns a list of valid targets for the seeker. :param seeker: :return: Array of targets

property itemLibrary¶

Returns the item library used by this game.

property levels¶

Returns the list of levels in this game.

loadGame(fileName)¶

Loads game state from a file :param fileName: :rtype : None

property monsterLibrary¶

Returns the monster library used by this game.

property player¶

The player of the game

resetPlayer()¶

Reset the player for this game. :rtype : None

saveGame(fileName)¶

Saves state of current game to a file. :param fileName: :rtype : None

setup_debug_game()¶

Similar to setup_new_game() but a utility function to enable debugging of new features. :return:

setup_new_game()¶

Resets this Game class to a play a new game. :rtype : None

property state¶

Returns the game state

tryToPlayTurn()¶

This function should be called regularly by the GUI. It waits for the player to take action after which all AI controlled characters also get to act. This is what moves the game forward. :rtype : Boolean indicating if a turn was played

WarrensGame.GameServer module¶

class WarrensGame.GameServer.LocalServer(host, port)¶

Bases: WarrensGame.GameServer.Server, threading.Thread

Game server running a local game and enabling remote clients to connect to it. This object will spawn an additional primary server thread that listens for incoming connection requests from clients. A client specific thread is created for every client that connects.

property client_threads¶

Running client threads. Client threads that exit or crash remove themselves from this list. :return:

property game¶

Game that is running on this Game server. :return:

property level¶

Proxy Json for the current level :return:

new_debug_game()¶

Setup a debug game. This allows to create custom game setup to debug new features. :return: None

new_local_game()¶

Setup a new game. :return: None

property player¶

Proxy Json for the player :return: Json object with player information

process()¶

Process communication backlog. Server will receive messages from connected clients. Since every client has its own thread there is not much to do here. Processing is handled in the client threads. :return: None

put_game_message(header, json_msg)¶
Parameters

  • header –

  • json_msg –

Returns

run()¶

Main loop of the server in which new client connections are established. This is started automatically through the Constructor which starts the thread. :return: None

stop()¶

Clean exit of the server processes. Stop waiting for new connections and terminate the server thread. This will also indirectly end the client specific worker threads. (they are dependent daemon threads and they stop running if the server stops running.) :return: None

class WarrensGame.GameServer.Proxy(json)¶

Bases: object

Wrapper around a dictionary object that can be used as a proxy object on client side. It only exposes the keys of the dictionary as methods providing access to the data.

property json¶

The json definition on which this object is based. :return: json in string format

class WarrensGame.GameServer.RemoteServer¶

Bases: WarrensGame.GameServer.Server

property level¶

Proxy for the current level :return: Proxy object with level information

property player¶

Proxy for the player :return: Proxy object with player information

process()¶

Process communication backlog. Receive messages from remote server. :return: None

put_game_message(header, json_msg)¶
Parameters

  • header –

  • json_msg –

Returns

receive_from_server()¶
class WarrensGame.GameServer.Server(connected_socket=None)¶

Bases: object

Base server class, will be subclassed for local and remote server implementation. This class provides the interface for the GUI to work both on LocalServer and RemoteServer. It also provides the send and receive logic to exchange Json data between client and server.

close_connection()¶

Close the communication socket. :return: None

connect(host, port)¶

Establish a new socket connection :param host: Host to connect to :param port: Port nbr to connect to

property level¶
property messageBuffer¶

Access to the game message buffer :return: Utilities.messageBuffer reference

property player¶
process()¶

Process communication backlog. :return: None

put_game_message(header, json_message)¶

Push a game message for communication. :param header: Message header :param json_message: Message content :return: None

receive()¶

Receive JSON data. If no message is waiting return None :return: json object or None

send(data)¶

Send JSON data, the message is prefixed with a length to facilitate the receiving process. :param data: json object :return: None

property socket¶

Socket used to send and receive messages. :return: Socket object or None

stop()¶

Clean exit of the server processes. :return: None

class WarrensGame.GameServer.ServerClientThread(server_thread, client_socket, client_address)¶

Bases: threading.Thread, WarrensGame.GameServer.Server

Client specific worker thread running on server side. This thread will handle a single client connection.

run()¶

Main loop for this thread in which communication with the client is handled. This is started automatically through the Constructor which starts the thread. :return: None

stop()¶

Terminates this client worker thread. :return: None

WarrensGame.Inventory module¶

Created on Apr 13, 2014

@author: pi

class WarrensGame.Inventory.Inventory(actor)¶

Bases: object

This class represents an inventory of Items. It will stack incoming items if they are stackable.

add(item)¶

Add an item to this inventory :param item: item to be added :return: None

find(item)¶

Search this inventory for the specified item. with the specified itemID. Matching is done based on itemID and modifierIDs. Returns None if the item is not found. :param item: Item to search for :return:Item or None

property item_count¶

Calculate the number of items in this inventory. This will include the stacksize in the totals. :return: Integer

property items¶

Basic array of all items in this inventory

property json¶

Json dictionary representation of the inventory. This will contain the data elements that are needed for the game client to function. :return: Json dictionary object

property owner¶

The character that owns this inventory

remove(item)¶

Remove one item from this inventory. If the item is not found nothing is done. If there is a stack of the item, one occurence will be removed from the stack. :param item: item to be removed :return: None

class WarrensGame.Levels.Level(owner, difficulty, name)¶

Bases: object

Class representing one level. This is the generic version containing the shared logic that is inherited by the sub classes

addCharacter(character)¶

Register the given character to this level.

addItem(item)¶

Register the given item to this level.

addPortal(portal)¶

Register the given portal to this level.

property characters¶

The characters on this level

property difficulty¶

The difficulty of this level.

property game¶

The game that owns this level.

getRandomEmptyTile()¶

Returns a randomly selected empty tile on this level.

property items¶

The items on this level

property json¶

Json dictionary representation of the Level. This will contain the data elements that are needed for the game client to function. :return: Json dictionary object

property map¶

The map of this level

property name¶

The name of the level.

property portals¶

The portals on this level

removeActor(myActor)¶

Remove the provided actor from this level. arguments

myActor - the actor that should be removed

property subLevels¶

Returns the list of sub levels in this level

class WarrensGame.Levels.SingleRoomLevel(owner, difficulty, name, area)¶

class WarrensGame.Libraries.MonsterLibrary¶

Bases: object

This class represents a library of monsters. Logic to create monsters goes here. It contains logic related to managing a population of monsters.

property available_monsters¶

Returns a list of monsters that can be created.

property challenge_index¶

Dictionary with an array of monster data dictionaries per challenge rating Keys are challenge rating. :return: Dictionary of arrays

create_monster(monster_key)¶

Function to create and initialize a new Monster. :param monster_key: string that identifies a monster in the config file. :return: Monster

generate_monster(difficulty)¶

Completely random generation of a monster, not based on the csv data file.

get_random_monster(max_challenge_rating)¶
static max_monsters_per_room(difficulty)¶
property monster_index¶

Dictionary that contains all monster data. Keys are monster keys. :return: Dictionary

Returns a list of all created Monster objects

Returns a list of all created regular Monster objects

property unique_monsters¶

Returns a list of all created unique Monster objects

class WarrensGame.Maps.DungeonMap(map_width, map_height, level=None)¶

This class represents a randomized dungeon map.

Clears the list of rooms in this dungeon.

generate a randomized dungeon map

getRandomEmptyTile()¶

finds a random empty tile on the map of this level

property rooms¶

Returns the rooms of this dungeon map. Note that this property is actually just a rename of the base class “areas” property.

class WarrensGame.Maps.Map(map_width, map_height, level)¶

Bases: object

Describes the 2D layout of a level Contains logic to calculate distance, intersection, field of view, …

property areas¶

List of rectangular sub areas on this map.

property each_map_position¶

Returns a 2D list that can be used to iterate over each map tile

property entryTile¶

Returns Tile on which entry to this map is located

property exitTile¶

Returns Tile on which exit of this map is located

property explored_tiles¶

Returns a list of all tiles explored. This includes tiles in and out of the visible range.

generate_map()¶

Place holder function, subclass must provide actual implementation.

getCircleTiles(x, y, radius, full_circle=False, exclude_blocked_tiles=False)¶

This utility function returns an array of tiles that approximates a circle on the map. Arguments

x - the x coordinate of the center of the circle y - the y coordinate of the center of the circle radius - the radius of the circle full_circle - when false only the tiles on the border of the circle are returned

  • when true all tiles inside.

exclude_blocked_tiles - excludes blocked tiles

getRandomEmptyTile()¶

Returns an empty tile on this level, excluding the outermost cells.

getRandomTile()¶

Returns a random Tile in this map. :return: Tile object

property height¶

Returns an integer indicating the height of the map

property json¶

Json dictionary representation of the map. This will contain the data elements that are needed for the game client to function. :return: Json dictionary object

property level¶

Returns the level for this Map. :return: Level or None

property range_of_view¶

Range of view used to determine field of view on this map.

refreshBlockedTileMatrix()¶

Refresh a 2D matrix of with True/False values indicating if a Tile position blocks line of sight. It is calculated separately for efficiency.

property texture_set¶
property tiles¶

Returns the tiles that make up this map.

updateFieldOfView(x, y)¶

Update the map tiles with what is in field of view, marking those as explored.

property visible_tiles¶

Returns a list of visible tiles.

property width¶

Returns an integer indicating the width of the map

class WarrensGame.Maps.SingleRoomMap(map_width, map_height, level, myRoom)¶

Bases: WarrensGame.Maps.Map

This class represents a very simple map with only one room. It can for example be used to represent the interior of a house.

Place holder function, subclass must provide actual implementation.

property room¶

Returns the room of this single room map.

class WarrensGame.Maps.TextureSet¶

Bases: object

Enumerator for texture set ID’s. Hack: The integer values correspond with tilesheet row numbers. This can be seen as an environment type deciding the feel of the place: a dark cave, a mossy cave, a dungeon, …

FENCE = 17¶
MARBLE_BLUE = 8¶
SANDSTONE = 1¶
STONE = 1¶
STONE_WITHERED = 2¶
class WarrensGame.Maps.Tile(map, x, y)¶

Bases: object

represents a Tile on the map

property actors¶

Returns actors on this tile.

addActor(myActor)¶

This function adds an actor to this tile

property blockSight¶

Returns a boolean indicating if this tile blocks line of sight.

property blocked¶

Returns a boolean indicating if this tile is blocked.

property color¶

Returns the preferred color of this tile.

property empty¶

Returns a boolean indicating if this tile is empty

property explored¶

Returns a boolean indicating if this tile has been explored.

property inView¶

Returns if this tile is in the player field of vision. This is set by the game engine during each turn.

property json¶

Json dictionary representation of the tile. This will contain the data elements that are needed for the game client to function. :return: Json dictionary object

property map¶

Returns the map on which this tile is located

property material¶

Property to store the material type of the tile.

removeActor(myActor)¶

This function removes an actor from this tile

property texture_hash¶

Integer hash representing the tile and the surrounding tiles. This hash can be used to decide which texture to use for the tile.

property texture_id¶

Property to store the tile set texture id for this tile. The GUI can use this to visualize the tile.

property texture_set¶

Property to store the texture set id for this tile. The GUI can use this to visualize the tile.

property type¶

Returns the type of this tile.

property x¶

Returns x coordinate of tile relevant to map

property y¶

Returns y coordinate of tile relevant to map

The list of houses in this town. Note that this property is actually just a rename of the base class “areas” property.

WarrensGame.Utilities module¶

Module with reusable utility functions

exception WarrensGame.Utilities.GameError(value)¶

Bases: Exception

Simple error that can be raised in case there is a problem with the game.

WarrensGame.Utilities.clamp(n, minimum, maximum)¶

This function returns the number n limited to the range min-max. This is for example used to keep coordinates within the limits of the map. :param n: number to clamp :param minimum: smallest allowed value :param maximum: largest allowed value :return: clamped number

WarrensGame.Utilities.distance_between_actors(actor1, actor2)¶

Calculate the Euclidean distance (straight line) between two actors. :param actor1: First actor :param actor2: Second actor :return: Distance between the two actors

WarrensGame.Utilities.distance_between_points(x, y, u, v)¶

Return the distance between two points (x, y) and (u, v).

WarrensGame.Utilities.game_event(header, json)¶

Utility function to report game events to the game server. This allows game objects to send updates via the game server to game clients :param header: message header :param json: json encoded game information :return: None

WarrensGame.Utilities.get_line_segments(x1, y1, x2, y2)¶

Returns a list of line segments that make up a line between two points. Returns [(x1, y1), (x2, y2), …]

Source: http://roguebasin.roguelikedevelopment.org/index.php?title=Bresenham%27s_Line_Algorithm

WarrensGame.Utilities.line_of_sight(matrix, x1, y1, x2, y2)¶

Returns True if there is line of sight between two points. Uses the matrix data to rely on blocking tiles. This is a matrix created with make_matrix(). matrix values of 0 or False are not solid, 1 or True are solid.

WarrensGame.Utilities.message(text, category=None)¶

Utility function to deal with in game messages. :param text: String representing the message :param category: String representing the category in which this message falls :return:

WarrensGame.Utilities.random_choice_index(chances)¶

Returns the index of a random choice based on a list of chances.

WarrensGame.Utilities.reset_utility_queues()¶
WarrensGame.Utilities.roll_hit_die(hitdie)¶

this function simulates rolling hit dies and returns the resulting nbr of hitpoints. Hit dies are specified in the format xdy where x indicates the number of times that a die (d) with y sides is thrown. For example 2d6 means rolling 2 six sided dices. Arguments

hitdie - a string in hitdie format

Returns

integer number of hitpoints

Module contents¶

This module contains the game logic.
